alert.note: Alert for Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Montgomery, northwestern Bath and south central Fleming Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 145 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sharpsburg, or 9 miles north of Mount Sterling, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sharpsburg around 150 PM EDT. Flat Creek around 155 PM EDT. Bethel and Reynoldsville around 200 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Sherburne, Odessa, Pebble, Oakley and Wyoming. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
